chapter.title: Applying a Patch
chapter.para: This chapter describes how to apply a patch and provides an example. It also provides information to update for your unique patch files, including changes for Java class files and other resources that you may want to periodically replace or add to your OpenAM web application. Class loading is implemented slightly differently by each servlet container. Some containers require you to apply a patch to an already deployed web application. For these containers, you can apply the patch like an update. Some containers will require that you always follow these steps to apply patches. ForgeRock strongly recommend that you rebuild the .war file to apply patches in a production environment.

note.para: For all tested containers, it is best to extract class files from the patch to the /path/to/expanded/war/WEB-INF/classes directory. This directory takes precedence over class libraries in the WEB-INF/lib.

procedure.title: To Apply a Patch
procedure.para: Follow these steps on each OpenAM server to apply a patch.

step.para: Verify that the JAVA_HOME is properly set.
Backup the file system directory for the current deployment.
Stop OpenAM, or if necessary to redeploy OpenAM, stop the container where OpenAM is running.
Deploy the customized patch .war file. You will need to deploy the patch .war file for all of your OpenAM instances.
Follow the instructions in the upgrade wizard if you are applying patches to OpenAM 10.0.0 or later.

example.title: Applying OpenAM 10.0.1
example.para: The following example applies the OpenAM 10.0.1 patch release to OpenAM 10.0.0 on an Ubuntu instance.

listitem.para: Verify that the JAVA_HOME is properly set.

listitem.screen:
$ cd /path/to/tomcat $ ./bin/shutdown.sh
Password: Using CATALINA_BASE: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_HOME: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_TMPDIR: /path/to/tomcat/temp Using JRE_HOME: /path/to/jdk1.6/jre Using CLASSPATH: /path/to/tomcat/bin/bootstrap.jar

listitem.para: In your browser, go to your instance of OpenAM and follow the instructions in the upgrade wizard.

example.para: Once you have verified that the deployment is complete, you can go back and delete the directories your created to expand the .war files.

procedure.title: To Apply a Unique Patch
procedure.para: Because these files will be specific to your instance, basic Tomcat instructions are provided to help clarify some steps instead of creating a separate example.

step.para: Backup the file system directory for the current deployment.
Create a new directory and expand your current .war file. You will be copying the patch.jar or class files directly into this area.
step.screen: $ cd /desired/location/for/expanding/files $ mkdir expanded-openam-war ; cd expanded-openam-war $ jar xvf /patch/to/tomcat/webapps/openam.war

step.para: Open the patch.jar file or any applicable class files you want to replace in this area.
Deploy the customized patch .war file on each OpenAM server, replacing the previous version.
